content: If there are three apples and you take away two, how many apples do you have?

If there are three apples and you take away two, you have two apples. The person who asked the question might be expecting the answer to be one, but in reality, if you take away two apples, you have those two apples in your possession. The person who asked the question might be trying to trick you or test your reasoning skills. But according to the literal meaning of the question, you have two apples.
